title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
cjdelisle left at 00:03 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds cjdelisle joined #xwiki at 00:04 rrodriguez left at 00:48 (Quit: rrodriguez jbrBridge joined #xwiki at 04:02 abusenius left at 04:07 (Quit: Konversation terminated! sdumitriu left at 06:15 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:31 venkatesh left at 06:32 (Client Quit venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:32 lucaa left at 07:11 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:12 mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:31 sburjan` joined #xwiki at 07:41 silviar joined #xwiki at 07:44 vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:10 vmassol left at 08:12 (Client Quit asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:19 sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:24 silviar left at 08:40 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan left #xwiki at 08:43 sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:43 silviar joined #xwiki at 08:45 kwoot joined #xwiki at 08:57 rrodriguez left at 09:13 (Quit: rrodriguez Denis joined #xwiki at 09:17 tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:26 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:29 sburjan - (09:31): tmortagne: do we still have the flickrmacro bundled by default ? (eg. #flickrusertag($id $tag), #flickr($rssfeed), #flickrtag($tag), etc) ? evalica joined #xwiki at 09:33 silviar left at 09:33 (Quit: Leaving. tmortagne - (09:34): sburjan: since flickr plugin as been removed i guess not. See http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5427 tmortagne - (09:34): or actually they are probably still here but they don't work i guess, you would need to ask sdumitriu sburjan - (09:34): I know about that, but I don;t know (at least I don't think) they are related. I'll ask Anca or Sergiu silviar joined #xwiki at 09:38 tmortagne - (09:41): sburjan: i just checked and flickrtag, flickruser and flickrusertag macros use flickr plugin so they are here but don't work tmortagne - (09:41): flickr macro use rss plugin sburjan - (09:43): tmortagne: they work. Tested on the last XE. but they are working only on Xwiki 1.0 syntax lucaa joined #xwiki at 09:43 tmortagne - (09:43): sburjan: actually i missread, they all use rss macro sburjan - (09:44): bad thing is that they support only 1.0 syntax sburjan - (09:44): but they work.. I still have no idea what was the old flikr plugin doing. tmortagne - (09:44): it's just that flickr\* macro call flickr macro tmortagne - (09:45): they work only in 1.0 syntax because they use xwiki/1.0 rss radeox macro sburjan - (09:46): I see. so by making the rss radeox macro 2.0 compatib, all macros that use it will support 2.0 ? tmortagne - (09:46): no tmortagne - (09:46): radeox macros only work in xwiki/1.0 tmortagne - (09:47): whatever you do top them sburjan - (09:47): I see. so this could be a drawback tmortagne - (09:48): the flickr macro could probably directly use the rss plugin instead of using rss radeox macro sburjan - (09:48): should I file a JIRA suggestion ? tmortagne - (09:53): if you want sburjan - (09:56): yeah, I'll file a suggestion. Should I make the suggestion only for the flickr macros, or all radeox macros that can rely on RSS plugin ? (so this would make all the macros that use radeox to be 2.0 compatib) tmortagne - (09:59): again radeox macro can't work in xwiki/2.0 syntax, you have to find a xwiki/2.0 macro equivalent to each of them to replace them fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 09:59 mflorea left at 10:06 (Quit: Leaving. rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:13 sburjan - (10:18): well all macros that are built upon radeox rss macro, to be modified to be upon rss feed plugin (that is 2.0) rrodriguez left at 10:23 (Quit: rrodriguez rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:25 sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:31 rrodriguez left at 10:32 (Quit: rrodriguez rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:35 rrodriguez left at 10:48 (Quit: rrodriguez jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:51 sburjan left #xwiki at 10:55 sburjan joined #xwiki at 10:55 mflorea joined #xwiki at 11:36 venkatesh left at 11:50 (Quit: Leaving sdumitriu - (12:04): sburjan: Ping sburjan - (12:04): sdumitriu: pong sdumitriu - (12:05): Can you document the office viewer on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise25M2 ? sdumitriu - (12:05): Ah, already done :) sburjan - (12:05): :) sdumitriu - (12:05): Good morning sburjan - (12:05): Good morning sdumitriu - (12:06): Then add some text on New User Directory sdumitriu - (12:06): I was too sleepy to think of anything florinciu joined #xwiki at 12:06 sburjan - (12:06): okay. evalica left at 12:22 (Quit: Leaving. silviar left at 12:26 (Quit: Leaving. sdumitriu - (12:32): sburjan: Tip, when making screenshots I try to make them 700px wide sdumitriu - (12:32): +2 border sdumitriu - (12:35): mflorea: Would you change the default quality, please? sdumitriu - (12:36): These images are really pixelated: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise25M2/comment-avatars.png sdumitriu - (12:41): Everyone, please check the release notes: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise25M2 jbrBridge - (12:47): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] In my pages I need some button like links to motivate the user do switch to a (non-xwiki) web formular. How can I realize this ? sdumitriu - (12:48): Hi Dirk sdumitriu - (12:49): Well, if you have the HTML that is supposed to display the link, you can just put it inside the html macro rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 13:18 sburjan - (13:18): sdumitriu: I usually follow the documentation regarding the screenshots sburjan - (13:20): sdumitriu: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/XWikiOrgDocumentationStandard evalica joined #xwiki at 13:20 sburjan - (13:22): sdumitriu: odd thing. If I watch a page from dev.xwiki.org, it's not listed on my watchlist sburjan - (13:22): is this normal ? venkatesh joined #xwiki at 13:22 mflorea - (13:22): sdumitriu: changing the default quality to 0.5 now sdumitriu - (13:22): sburjan: No sburjan - (13:23): then something changed on xwiki.org, because this worked in the past venkatesh left at 13:23 (Client Quit sburjan - (13:24): watching spaces doesnt work either sburjan - (13:25): I guess this is a XEM problem sburjan - (13:38): sdumitriu: congrats :) sdumitriu - (13:39): Thanks sburjan - (13:39): we finally released .. sdumitriu - (13:39): Yes, it only took me a week sburjan - (13:41): sdumitriu: shoul I test the Watchlist bug in 2.4.3 XEM ? sburjan - (13:41): \*should venkatesh joined #xwiki at 13:41 sdumitriu - (13:41): Yes abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:43 silviar joined #xwiki at 13:45 sburjan - (13:47): sdumitriu: I am unable to reproduce locally. on 2.4.3 XEM sburjan - (13:47): but silviar has the same problem. Watchlist is simply dead on xwiki.org sburjan - (13:49): maybe it's something about the subdomains .. which I am unable to create locally. I am unable to investigate this further sdumitriu - (13:49): Well, xwiki.org is on 2.3, maybe it's something that was fixed since then sdumitriu - (13:50): Do you see anything at all in the watchlist? sburjan - (13:50): nothing sdumitriu - (13:50): Then it's simply a broken livetable sburjan - (13:51): well the table loads flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 14:00 sburjan - (14:01): this worked 2 months ago sburjan - (14:08): nop. nothing. sdumitriu - (14:12): But it's just a display problem sdumitriu - (14:12): The object has the right values sdumitriu - (14:12): platform:AdminGuide.ImportExport,code:Applications.WatchlistApplication,platform:DevGuide.Architecture,platform:Features.PageEditing,xwiki:Main.ReleaseNotes,xwiki:Main.ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise24,xwiki:Main.ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise25M2,xoffice:Main.WebHome sburjan - (14:12): oh, okay sburjan - (14:13): so can you fix it ? venkatesh left at 14:17 (Remote host closed the connection kwoot - (14:18): Hello. Just a quick question from my side. Some time ago I mentioned to extend the link syntax to be able to point to a desired template. See Jira XWIKI-5473. With 25M2 I read about syntax 2.1. Great. So, as an example, what would my syntax be for pointing a link to a template? venkatesh joined #xwiki at 14:19 kwoot - (14:19): Did I mention how cool I think it is to have an idea of mine somehow seems included in the code you build? Way cool! venkatesh left at 14:19 (Client Quit sdumitriu - (14:20): Hehe, yes, that's one of the greater parts of open source sdumitriu - (14:20): Being involved and taken into account venkatesh joined #xwiki at 14:20 sburjan - (14:21): thanks sdumitriu .. it works now :) what was the problem ? sdumitriu - (14:21): sburjan: Well, the platform was updated, but the wiki wasn't sburjan - (14:21): I see kwoot - (14:21): As a small report of my progress on updating the default xar. I made a python script to convert xwiki/1.0 pages to xwiki/2.0 syntax. Next I am building a php file to compare the versions and do manual correctiosn where needed. Due to the fact that I have a kid in the hospital for planned surgery and because of this also the chance to replace the kitchen, time available for xwiki stuff is currenly limited. sorry. sdumitriu - (14:22): The page that was supposed to return the content of the watchlist had a deprecated check sdumitriu - (14:22): It wasn't returning anything sburjan - (14:22): I see. so it was a velocity level error sburjan - (14:22): not some core stuff sdumitriu - (14:22): Yes sburjan - (14:22): I see :) sdumitriu - (14:22): kwoot: Good luck with all of that kwoot - (14:23): sdumitriu: thanks. All progress is on our family blog, but it is in Dutch :-) sdumitriu - (14:23): I don't know the answer to your question yet kwoot - (14:23): As always there were complications but situation is stable now. kwoot - (14:24): sdumitriu: I know about the greater parts of open source. I wrote a book about it once. Well actually 7 books :-) kwoot - (14:25): Maybe I should write a book about xwiki. But time is, well, limited :-) sdumitriu - (14:26): kwoot: This seems to work: sdumitriu - (14:26): \* [[Create a new thing>>Sandbox.NewPage||queryString="template=Blog.BlogPostTemplate"]] sdumitriu - (14:27): Is this what you wanted? kwoot - (14:29): wow, yes, yes, yes, yes!!!! :-) kwoot - (14:30): other questionL: i think user profile page should have an 'about me' tab and also that being the first tab. In what jira section should I create an issue that describes this? sdumitriu - (14:30): XWiki Administration Application kwoot - (14:30): thanks. sdumitriu - (14:31): (It's not that intuitive in this case) kwoot - (14:32): Ok. entering it now. lucaa left at 14:32 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:36 kwoot - (14:39): Working with open source makes me often feel like a dog. I see a new feature and it has the same effect as showing a cooky to a dog. He starts moving his tail, tongue drops out and he is full of anticipation. :-) kwoot\_ joined #xwiki at 14:43 sdumitriu - (14:45): kwoot: Can XWIKI-5473 be closed now? kwoot - (14:46): It hink yes. kwoot - (14:46): eh, I think yes. kwoot\_ left at 14:47 (Client Quit rrodriguez left at 14:50 (Quit: rrodriguez sburjan left at 14:52 (Quit: Ex-Chat Enygma` left at 14:53 (Quit: Leaving. sdumitriu - (14:55): Starting to upgrade myxwiki.org Enygma` joined #xwiki at 14:56 silviar left at 15:03 (Quit: Leaving. sburjan` left at 15:12 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds venkatesh left at 15:20 (Remote host closed the connection vmassol joined #xwiki at 15:35 vmassol - (15:35): grrr was offline…. I updtaed to the latest adium last week and it now fails to reconnect automatically…. :( vmassol - (15:36): mflorea: fyi I'm modifying the way to store links in HTML comments vmassol - (15:36): (in order to solve http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5546) mflorea - (15:36): vmassol: ok vmassol - (15:36): the new format I'm proposing to use is independent of the syntax. For example: vmassol - (15:36):

Space.ExistingPage

vmassol - (15:37): I guess you'll have some fixing to do in the wysiwyg code? tmortagne - (15:37): basically it's more or less macro marker syntax mflorea - (15:39): vmassol: yes, right now I consider the text after startwikilink to be the link reference. I'll have to parse the text to extract the link reference and the rest of the parameters vmassol - (15:40): I could provide a parser for you if that helps vmassol - (15:40): right now I have somrething like: vmassol - (15:40):         String[] tokens = StringUtils.splitByWholeSeparator(linkComment, COMMENT\_SEPARATOR); vmassol - (15:40):         boolean isTyped = tokens[0].equalsIgnoreCase("true") ? true : false; vmassol - (15:40):         LinkType type = new LinkType(tokens[1]); vmassol - (15:40):         String reference = tokens[2]; vmassol - (15:40):         WikiParameters linkParams = WikiParameters.EMPTY; vmassol - (15:40):         WikiParameters referenceParams = WikiParameters.EMPTY; vmassol - (15:40):         if (tokens.length == 4) { vmassol - (15:40):             referenceParams = WikiParameters.newWikiParameters(tokens[3]); vmassol - (15:40):         } evalica left at 15:41 (Read error: Connection reset by peer sdumitriu - (15:42): myxwikiorg updated mflorea - (15:43): it depends whether I need the link parameters on the client or not. For the moment I think I can send the entire string that follows startwikilink to the server and parse it there using your parser, but in the future I might need to know the components on the client, and sending a request just for parsing this string is an overhead kwoot left at 15:44 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds mflorea - (15:44): vmassol: i.e. for the moment the client can continue to think that the string after startwikilink is the link reference and only the server side is changed mflorea - (15:45): I'll fix the editor after you commit Enygma` left at 15:48 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds vmassol - (15:51): mflorea: ok thanks. I still need a few hours mflorea - (15:51): ok sdumitriu - (15:53): Lots'o'Spamming on playground.myxwiki.org abusenius left at 15:55 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds cjdelisle - (15:55): maybe a good idea to put a robots.txt which blocks crawlers. cjdelisle - (15:56): Wouldn't want google to get the idea that we support that kind of thing ;) asrfel left at 16:03 (Quit: Leaving. rrodriguez\_ joined #xwiki at 16:34 lucaa - (16:40): hi team lucaa - (16:41): I have committed XWIKI-5544 and XWIKI-5545 thursday but I forgot to add them as dep to xwiki-core so that they are distributed by default lucaa - (16:41): does that mean the issues were never fixed and I reopen? or I create a new issue to bundle them with the platform by default and I close that one for RC ? vmassol - (16:44): reopen lucaa - (16:44): vmassol: ? lucaa - (16:44): :) lucaa - (16:44): ok vmassol - (16:44): got you! lucaa - (16:44): my client reports the lines in the same second tmortagne - (16:44): vmassol: i almost tough you where serious vmassol - (16:45): I am serious.... tmortagne - (16:45): it has been released tmortagne - (16:45): can't reopen it vmassol - (16:45): it was wrongly closed tmortagne - (16:45): "Create container macro that allows various layouts and decoration for contained objects" is true vmassol - (16:45): I can close all issues in jira for 2.5RC1 vmassol - (16:45): it doesn't mean that are done vmassol - (16:45): :) tmortagne - (16:45): it's just that it's not part of the default distribution tmortagne - (16:45): vmassol: this issue is done vmassol - (16:46): for me jira is for users vmassol - (16:46): so for users they are not available vmassol - (16:46): so the 2 solutions are fine vmassol - (16:46): but for me they are useless as they are for users vmassol - (16:47): I'm fine with any solution vmassol - (16:47): back to my bug… :) florinciu left at 16:49 (Read error: Connection reset by peer lucaa - (16:55): so, tmortagne, you feel we should create new issues? lucaa - (16:56): I'm not really sure, I am fine with any solution tmortagne - (16:56): IMO anything released freeze the related jira issue, if something is missing then it's a bug and a new jira issue tmortagne - (16:58): unless nothing as been done for this jira issue of course (in which case it does not really make sense to close it anyway) tmortagne - (17:03): said another way, for me the fact that http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core-rendering-macro-dashboard/2.5-milestone-2/ exists make XWIKI-5544 true, if the issue is reopened and closed for 2.5RC1 then what is on maven does not make any sense
